divs: sighting detailsi live in the 4th floor of an apartment building. i've made a habit of going out to the balcony at night just to view the stars, relax or watch airplanes flying over or just get fresh air. i live in an area where planes fly over all the time as they make their descent towards pearson international airport so i'm familiar with how a plane looks like and sounds like at night. there were a few clouds in the sky and just like any ordinary night, i went out to the balcony to relax and watch this particularly bright star up in the northeast direction. then at 12:10 a.m., i saw someting at the left of the star and i thought it could just be another airplane. as it moved closer, i noticed that there were no lights pulsing \ blinking anywhere it and it looked opaque and grayish white. despite some cloudcover, this thing stood out because the clouds appeared reddish due to light pollution. i waited for the typical jet sounds but there was none, it was silent. this thing moved faster than most landing jets. the flying object is almost over me now that i have to tilt my head up. then i noticed that this object looked oval and it seemed to be rotating in its axis that it looked liked it's triangular-oval. still no signs of lights or sounds from the object. then it made a swift and sharp turn to the left, got lightly obscured by clouds then it reappeared and hovered on one spot. it still looked liked it was rotating on it's axis. it hovered for several minutes then it moved slowly to the left and just simply vanished, not into the clouds but its just disppeared in a small clear patch of sky between the clouds. it was now 12:35 a.m. before i decided to report this, i thought of several things that i could closely identify the object with: 1. a jet or airplane - most jets have rhythmic blinking lights on their wings and tails. this thing however showed no lights or sound at all. 2. migratory birds - i do see some birds flying over sometimes and i could make out their wings flapping. the object i saw was solitary and it was rotating on it's axis and it hovered on one spot at one point. 3. kite or some wind-blown object - i ruled this out because it wasn't windy that night at all. the clouds were steady and any wind blown object could not hover and move across the sky all at the same time. fast info: aug. 27, 2007 (12:10 - 12:35 a.m.) weather: calm with few clouds, stars still visible. clouds appeared reddish due to light pollution. object sighted: north east near a bright star (capella?) just slightly lower from the constellation perseus. object characteristic: opaque. grayish white, generally oval (a bit triangular), fast moving, spinning on axis and has the ability to hover and make sharp changes in direction. no lights or sound heard from object. object size: it looks like its in a fairly high altitude. i could cover it with my thumb. note: i've attached my illustration of the object in a "time-frame" manner.
